data.title: CHEVIS BROOKE ENGLISH - JOHN ERIC DOUVILLE
data.meta_description: Chevis Brooke English became the bride of John Eric Douville at 7 p.m.
data.text:
— Chevis Brooke English became the bride of John Eric Douville at 7 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 17, in Arlington Hall in Dallas. Preston Morrison of Gateway Church officiated.

Parents of the bride are Darla English of Dallas and Dr. Jim English of Little Rock. Her grandparents are Sandra and Alfred Shelnutt of Benton and Virginia and Jay Loyd English of Sardis.

The groom is the son of Christine and Roy Douville of Plano, Texas. He is the grandson of Catherine Albiez of Mobile, Ala., and the late Walter E. Douville, the late Mary Catherine Hawkins of Franklin, Tenn., and the late T. Jackson Hawkins of Lake Worth, Fla.

The couple exchanged vows in front of a filigree cross handcrafted by the groom’s father. Garden urns filled with hydrangeas, roses, lisianthus, orchids and lilies decorated the chancel.

Given in marriage by her father, the bride wore an asymmetrically layered gown of silk tulle and lace. A pink satin sash at the waist was encrusted with Austrian crystals. Her silk illusion veil was cathedral-length and she carried a bouquet of dendrobium orchids, cabbage roses and hydrangeas in shades of ivory and pale pink.

Rachel Parker Harding of Little Rock was matron of honor. Bridesmaids were Adrienne Michelle Dillard of Cambridge, Mass., Elizabeth Scott Feller of Dallas and Isis Marie Hargrave of Fort Worth. Junior bridesmaid was Kara Elizabeth McGhee of Benton.

They wore blush pink gowns withsweep trains and carried bouquets of hydrangeas, cabbage roses and dusty miller.

Madeline May Douville, the couple’s dog, served as a flower dog. Ring bearers were Stellan Chase Shelnutt of Benton and Forrest John Bahl III of Palm Beach, Fla.

Best man was Nicholas Adam Douville of Plano. Groomsmen were Richard Bruce Beauchamp Jr. of Fort Worth; Colin Williams Helffrich and Alexander James Nierling, both of Dallas; and Zachary Lynn Glover of Fayetteville.

Guests were seated by Jerome Lee Davis Jr. and Christopher Michael Pope, both of Plano, Casey Ryan Trammell of Houston and Casen Michael McGhee of Benton.

A reception at Arlington Hall followed the ceremony. The hall was decorated with English garden arrangements of pale pink, ivory and green wedding flowers. Tall candelabra accented with crystals and wedding flowers marked the dance floor. Music was by the Mars Hill Band of Dallas.

The bride has a bachelor’s degree in communications from the University of Arkansas at Fayetteville and a master’s degree in business administration from Dallas Baptist University. She is a brand manager at Advanced Beauty Systems.

The groom, also a UA graduate, has a bachelor’s degree in business administration. He is a product manager with OrthoScan.

The couple will make their home in Dallas after a wedding trip to Maui, Hawaii.
